author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Chief Minister’s Relief Fund of Rs. 5 lakh each was handed over to kin of six farmers of Pethanayakkanpalayam block in the district who were killed during the police firing while taking part in the farmers’ agitation in 1972.

The farmers had launched agitation in Pethanayakkanpalayam on July 5, 1972 demanding that the government reduce the power tariff.

When the police opened fire to disperse them, nine were killed.

R. Sukumar, District Revenue Officer, handed over the cheques to Angammal (wife of Arumugam); M. Palanisamy (brother of Muthusamy); Periyasamy (nephew of Santhamoorthy); Sivappayee (daughter-in-law of Muttasu alias Ramasamy); Vijayaragavan (son of Vivekanandan); Parvathi (wife of Ramasamy). S. Madeswaran, MLA; K. Kavithan, Project Director, District Rural Development Agency; Selvan, Revenue Divisional Officer, Attur; were present.
title: Kin of those killed in 1972 police firing gets relief
